resources.string:
Ingredients 6 servings

  • \u20222 cups whole-wheat rotini(6 ounces)
  • \u20222 ⅓ cup reduced-fat mayonnaise
  • \u20222 ⅓ cup low-fat plain yogurt
  • \u20222 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
  • \u20222 tablespoon red-wine vinegar, or lemon juice
  • \u20222 clove garlic, minced
  • \u20222 teaspoon salt
  • \u20222 cup cherry or grape tomatoes, halved
  • \u20222 Freshly ground pepper, to taste
  • \u20222 cup diced yellow or red bell pepper, (1 small)
  • \u20222 cup grated carrots, (2-4 carrots)
  • \u20222 cup chopped pitted Kalamata olives
  • \u20222 ½ cup chopped scallions, (4 scallions)
  • \u20222 ⅓ cup slivered fresh basil

Preparation

\u20222 Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta, stirring occasionally, until just tender, 8 to 10 minutes, or according to package directions. Drain and refresh under cold running water.

\u20222 Whisk mayonnaise, yogurt, oil, vinegar (or lemon juice), garlic, salt and pepper in a large bowl until smooth. Add the pasta and toss to coat. Add tomatoes, bell pepper, carrots, scallions, olives and basil; toss to coat well.

Make Ahead Tip: Cover and refrigerate for up to 1 day.

Ingredients 5 servings

  • \u20222 2 teaspoons plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, divided
  • \u20222 ½ cup carrot or diced red bell pepper
  • \u20222 1 large boneless, skinless chicken breast (about 8 ounces), cut into quarters
  • \u20222 1 large clove garlic, minced
  • \u20222 5 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth
  • \u20222 1½ teaspoons dried marjoram
  • \u20222 6 ounces baby spinach, coarsely chopped
  • \u20222 1 15-ounce can cannellini beans or great northern beans, rinsed
  • \u20222 ¼ cup grated Parmesan cheese
  • \u20222 ⅓ cup lightly packed fresh basil leaves
  • \u20222 Freshly ground pepper to taste
  • \u20222 ¾ cup plain or herbed multigrain croutons for garnish (optional)

Preparation

\u20222 Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add carrot (or bell pepper) and chicken; cook, turning the chicken and stirring frequently, until the chicken begins to brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook, stirring, for 1 minute more. Stir in broth and marjoram; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes

\u20222 With a slotted spoon, transfer the chicken pieces to a clean cutting board to cool. Add spinach and beans to the pot and bring to a gentle boil. Cook for 5 minutes to blend the flavors. Combine the remaining 1 tablespoon oil, Parmesan and basil in a food processor (a mini processor works well). Process until a coarse paste forms, adding a little water and scraping down the sides as necessary. Cut the chicken into bite-size pieces. Stir the chicken and pesto into the pot. Season with pepper. Heat until hot. Garnish with croutons, if desired.

Ingredients 4 servings

  • \u20222 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, divided
  • \u20222 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • \u20222 1 small onion, diced
  • \u20222 1 tablespoon lemon juice
  • \u20222 4 cups peeled, seeded and thinly sliced cucumbers, divided
  • \u20222 1½ cups vegetable broth, or reduced-sodium chicken broth
  • \u20222 ½ teaspoon salt
  • \u20222 ¼ teaspoon freshly ground pepper
  • \u20222 Pinch of cayenne pepper
  • \u20222 1 avocado, diced
  • \u20222 ¼ cup chopped fresh parsley, plus more for garnish
  • \u20222 ½ cup low-fat plain yogurt (optional)

Preparation

\u20222 Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, 1 to 4 minutes. Add lemon juice and cook for 1 minute. Add 3¾ cups cucumber slices, broth, salt, pepper and cayenne; bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and cook at a gentle simmer until the cucumbers are soft, 6 to 8 minutes..

\u20222 Transfer the soup to a blender. Add avocado and parsley; blend on low speed until smooth. (Use caution when pureeing hot liquids.) Pour into a serving bowl and stir in yogurt. Chop the remaining ¼ cup cucumber slices. Serve the soup warm or refrigerate and serve it chilled. Just before serving, garnish with the chopped cucumber and more chopped parsley, if desired. Make Ahead Tip: Refrigerate for up to 4 hours.

Make Ahead Tip: Serving size: about 1 cup

  • \u20222 Per serving: 169 calories; 12 g fat(2 g sat); 5 g fiber; 14 g carbohydrates; 4 g protein; 71 mcg folate; 2 mg cholesterol; 6 g sugars; 879 IU vitamin A; 17 mg vitamin C; 99 mg calcium; 1 mg iron; 494 mg sodium; 536 mg potassium
  • \u20222 Nutrition Bonus: Vitamin C (28% daily value)
  • \u20222 Carbohydrate Servings: 1

An easy, vegetarian version of classic salad Niçoise with tomatoes, green beans, eggs, and white beans.

Ingredients 2 servings

FOR THE SALAD

  • \u20222 3 large eggs, at room temperature
  • \u20222 6 ounces green beans, ends trimmed
  • \u20222 4 ounces mixed greens
  • \u20222 6 ounces cherry tomatoes, halved if large
  • \u20222 1 small cucumber, seeded, and diced
  • \u20222 1/3 cup small black olives or halved large olives, pitted
  • \u20222 7 ounces white beans, such as cannellini, rinsed and drained
  • \u20222 3 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf or curly parsley
  • \u20222 Freshly ground black pepper

FOR THE VINAIGRETTE

  • \u20222 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
  • \u20222 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
  • \u20222 1/2 shallot, minced
  • \u20222 1/8 teaspoon kosher salt
  • \u20222 1/4 cup olive oil

Preparation

\u20222 Hard boil the eggs: In a small pot, bring just enough water to cover the eggs to a gentle boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and gently lower the eggs in with a slotted spoon. Bring water to a low, rumbling boil, then let cook for 9 minutes. A few minutes before the eggs are finished cooking, prepare an ice bath. Remove the eggs from the boiling water and plunge into the cold water. Let rest a few minutes, then tap the eggs with back of a spoon to crack them (this will make peeling easier). Return to the ice water to cool completely, then peel and cut into wedges.

\u20222 Blanch the green beans: Bring a large pot of water to a boil, then drop in green beans. Boil until bright green and crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Drop the cooked beans into an ice bath to shock the green beans and stop the cooking (for ease, empty then refill the ice bath used for the eggs). Drain and set aside.

\u20222 Prepare the dressing: Whisk together the lemon juice, mustard, shallot, and salt. While whisking, drizzle in the olive oil. (Alternatively, you can shake all of the dressing ingredients together in a tightly-sealed mason jar.).

\u20222 Place the salad greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and green beans in a large salad bowl and toss with the desired amount of dressing, reserving some to drizzle on at the end (any extra dressing can be reserved for a later time). Scatter white beans and olives over the top, then arrange eggs around the sides. Drizzle with remaining vinaigrette and sprinkle with parsley and black pepper.

Ingredients 5 servings

  • \u20222 Tomatoes – 3 Medium Sized
  • \u20222 Asparagus – 6 Stalks
  • \u20222 Carrots – 3

Preparation

\u20222 Wash and chop all the vegetables roughly and add it to the food processor, add 1/4th cup of water, blend well and pour in a serving glass. Enjoy with a hint of lemon juice and mint.
